definition_en: Load spectrum is a 2d histogram that contains the load history of a vehicle, i.e. how a vehicle was used, for a given time period.

relation_from: vehicle, part, vehicle component, vehicle current state

example_en: torque vs rotational speed in the 4th/6th/reverse gear

definition_en: details about the load spectrum: who, what, where, when, how?
start of the measurement of load spectrum
end of the measurement of load spectrum
The channel contains information about the axis of the 1d or 2d histogram.

identifier: load spectrum channel number of bins

definition_en: The values contains a list or a matrix with count values of the histogram.
